description: Socks.  Put 'em on your feet.
Warm socks made of wool.
Guaranteed to make you run faster and jump higher!
Tough leather boots.  Very durable.
Boots lined with fur for warmth.
Leather boots with a steel toe.  Extremely durable.
Cumbersome boots designed for warmth.
Simple shoes made from animal pelts.
Simple sandals.  Very difficult to run in.
Fancy patent leather shoes.  Not designed for running in.
A pair of high heels.  Difficult to even walk in.
Boots made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Light and durable.
A pair of khaki shorts.
A pair of shorts lined with pockets, offering decent storage.
A pair of blue jeans with two deep pockets.
A pair of khaki pants.  Slightly warmer than jeans.
A pair of black leather pants.  Very tough, but cumbersome and without much storage.
A pair of pants lined with pockets, offering lots of storage.
A tough pair of pants lined with pockets.  Favored by the military.
A pair of pants meant for alpine skiing.
A hefty pair of fur-lined pants.
A pair of long underwear that help to maintain body temperature.
A short, breezy cotton skirt.  Easy to move in, but only has a single small pocket.
A thin, short-sleeved jumpsuit; similar to those worn by prisoners.  Provides decent storage and is not very encumbering.
An outfit fit for the King...
A full body fursuit in the form of an anthropomorphic wolf.  It is quite encumbering and has little storage but is very warm.
A long cotton dress.  Difficult to move in and lacks any storage space.
Leg and body armor made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Light and durable.
A full-body cotton suit.  Makes the apocalypse a truly gentlemanly experience.
A hazardous materials suit.  Though quite bulky and cumbersome, wearing it will provide excellent protection against ambient radiation.
An extremely heavy ornamental suit of armor.
A short-sleeved cotton shirt.
A t-shirt embroided with the pattern of an American flag.
A short-sleeved cotton shirt, slightly thicker than a t-shirt.
A white button-down shirt with long sleeves.  Looks professional!
A sleeveless cotton shirt.  Very easy to move in.
A thick cotton shirt.  Provides warmth and a bit of padding.
A wool shirt.  Provides warmth.
A sweatshirt with a hood and a "kangaroo pocket" in front for storage.
Sports wear that clings to your chest to maintain body temperature.
A thin cotton jacket.  Good for brisk weather.
A jacket made from denim.  Provides decent protection from cuts.
A professional-looking wool blazer.  Quite cumbersome.
A jacket made from thick leather.  Cumbersome, but offers excellent protection from cuts.
A heavy bulletproof vest.  The best protection from cuts and bullets.
A plastic coat with two very large pockets.  Provides protection from rain and some protection from acid rain.
A simple wool garment worn over the torso.  Provides a bit of protection.
A thin cotton trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage.
A brightly-colored vest designed to keep you upright and floating in water.
A thick leather trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage.
A thick fur trenchcoat, lined with pockets.  Great for storage.
A padded coat with deep pockets.  Very warm.
A fur coat with a couple small pockets.  Extremely warm.
A heavy cotton coat.  Cumbersome, but warm and with deep pockets.
A light vest covered in pockets and straps for storage.
A vest made from thick leather.  Offers excellent protection from cuts.
A light vest covered in webbing, pockets and straps.  This variety is favoured by the military.
A long white coat with several large pockets.
A pair of soft neoprene arm sleeves, often used in contact sports.
A pair of neoprene arm sleeves covered with molded plastic sheaths.
A pair of arm guards made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Light and durable.
A pair of arm guards hammered out from metal.  Very stylish.
A pair of thin cotton gloves.  Often used as a liner beneath other gloves.
A pair of cotton gloves.
A pair of warm mittens.  They are extremely cumbersome.
A pair of warm fur gloves.  They are somewhat cumbersome.
A thick pair of wool gloves.  Cumbersome but warm.
A pair of padded gloves.  Cumbersome but warm.
A thin pair of leather gloves.  Good for doing manual labor.
A pair of leather gloves with no fingers, allowing greater manual dexterity.
A pair of rubber gloves, often used while cleaning with caustic materials.
A pair of thin latex gloves, designed to limit the spread of disease.
A heavy pair of leather gloves, used by firefighters for heat protection.
Gauntlets made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Very light and durable.
A simple piece of cotton that straps over the mouth.  Provides a small amount of protection from air-borne illness and dust.
A cotton bandana, worn over the mouth for warmth and minor protection from dust and other contaminants.
A long wool scarf, worn over the mouth for warmth.
A long fur scarf, worn over the mouth for warmth.
A mask that straps over your mouth and nose and filters air.  Protects from smoke, dust, and other contaminants quite well.
A full gas mask that covers the face and eyes.  Provides excellent protection from smoke, teargas, and other contaminants.
A pair of glasses for the near-sighted.  Useless for anyone else.
A pair of glasses for the far-sighted.  Useless for anyone else.
A pair of bifocal glasses for those who are both near-sighted and far-sighted.
A pair of plastic glasses, used in workshops, sports, chemistry labs, and many other places.  Provides great protection from damage.
A small pair of goggles.  Distorts vision above water, but allows you to see much further under water.
A large pair of goggles that completely seal off your eyes.  Excellent protection from environmental dangers.
A dark pair of goggles.  They make seeing very difficult, but protect you from bright flashes.
A pair of goggles that amplify ambient light, allowing you to see in the dark.  You must be carrying a powered-on unified power supply, or UPS, to use them.
An essential article of the gentleman's apparel.  Also negates near-sight.
A pair of sunglasses, good for keeping the glare out of your eyes.
A Red Sox cap.  It provides a little bit of warmth.
Also called a "bucket hat." Often used in the military.
A snug-fitting cotton hat.  Quite warm.
A snug-fitting wool hat.  Very warm.
A red plaid hunting cap with ear flaps.  Notably warm.
A hat made from the pelts of animals.  Extremely warm.
A warm covering that protects the head and face from cold.
A hard plastic hat worn in constructions sites.  Excellent protection from cuts and percussion.
A spiked helmet once worn by German military officers.  The spike is very sharp.
A soft cotton hat commonly worn by armed forces and existentialists.
A thick foam helmet.  Designed to protect against concussion.
A small metal helmet that covers the head and protects against cuts and percussion.
A hard plastic helmet that covers the head and ears.  Designed to protect against a baseball to the head.
A heavy helmet that provides excellent protection from all sorts of damage.
A helmet with a plastic shield that covers your entire face.
A helmet with covers for your head and chin, leaving space in-between for you to wear goggles.
A helmet made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Covers the entire head; very light and durable.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection to the entire head, at the cost of great encumbrance.
The only hat for a gentleman.  Look exquisite while laughing in the face of danger!
A small backpack, good storage for a little encumbrance.
A huge military rucksack, provides a lot of storage.
A bit cumbersome to wear, but provides some storage
Light and easy to wear, but doesn't offer much storage.
Provides a bit of extra storage without encumbering you at all.
Provides a bit of extra storage without encumbering you at all.
A small holster worn on the ankle.
A makeshift bag, cobbled together from rags.  Really gets in the way, but provides a decent amount of storage.
A bag stitched together from leather scraps.  Doesn't hold an awful lot but is easy to wear.
A flashy gold ring.  You can wear it if you like, but it won't provide any effects.
A nice silver necklace.  You can wear it if you like, but it won't provide any effects.
A small relic from a forgotten saint.  As extraordinary as the world has become it may have some power yet.
A plastic badge with an embedded film strip.  The film strip changes color as it it is exposed to radiation.  Wear on your lapel so you can notice if it changes.
A tarnished gold star gives an air of authority to the wearer.
A large American flag made to fly in even the worst conditions.
Hiding under here will not protect you from the monsters.
A heavy fur blanket that covers most of your body.
A compact wool blanket that covers your most important body parts.
A large sleeping bag that covers you head to toe.
A large sleeping bag lined with fur.  Who needs a tent?
Makes you wish you had running water to take a shower.
Perfect for reading all those books you stole.
A heavy cloak that is thrown over your body.
A heavy fur cloak that is thrown over your body.
A heavy leather cloak that is thrown over your body.  Provides decent protection
Stylish cloak.
The DoubleTech Power Armor, Mk.  I: A heavy suit of basic power armor, offering very good protection against attacks, but hard to move in.
A basic helmet, designed for use with the DOubleTech Power Armor, Mk.  I.  Offers excellent protection from both attacks and environmental hazards.
A suit of DoubleTech Power Armor, Mk.  II-L.  This model offers several improvements over the Mk.  I, most notably the weight.
A power armor helmet designed for use with the DoubleTech Power Armor, Mk.  II-L.  This improved design is lighter and cooler than the Mk.  I helmet.
A suit of DoubleTech Power Armor, Mk.  II-H.  This model offers several improvements over the Mk.  I, most notably the its environmental protection.
A power armor helmet designed for use with the DoubleTech Power Armor, Mk.  II-H.  This improved design is heavier than the Mk.  I helmet, but cooler, and offers better environmental protection.
A heavy duty hauling frame designed to interface with power armor.
A tool to help set bones and hold them in place
A tool to help set bones and hold them in place
A pair of polyurethane leg guards with neoprene backing.
A pair of leg guards hammered out from metal.  Very stylish.
A simple wristwatch.
A snug-fitting black knit cap.  Quite warm.  Not very effective at hiding your idity, but nice try.
A tan hat, bleached by the desert sun.  The hat of a genuine freak, never intended for mass production.
This thing looks like it's been around since atleast the sixties.  It looks bleached by the desert sun, and smells of strange and exotic narcotics..
That whore.  Tried to take everything I had.  But I taught her and that lawyer.  They're both dead! I got my ring back from her corpse.
A Jersey for the Buffalo Bills.  Number 32.  Has mysterious red specks on it.
Would you fuck me? I'd fuck me.  I'd fuck me hard...
But first we need the car.  And after that the cocaine.  And then the tape recorder, for special music, and some Acapulco shirts.
A thin pair of leather gloves covered in blood.  Good for doing in the ex-wife and her lover.  You'll be damned if she inherits your estate.
Know your Dope Fiend! You will not be able to see his eyes because of T-Shades, but inside, he is white with inner tension.
An authoritarian outfit.  Looks like something a Fascist would wear.
Jean shorts.  A key component of neckbeard attire.
An outfit fit for the King...
A fedora is a felt hat originally designed for a woman but is now most commonly worn by men.  Goony men.
